publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3773 Pauline McNeill: Drug Rape—That the Parliament congratulates Strathclyde Police on responding to increasing public concern over date rape drugs and taking the matter seriously and welcomes the force's "Drug Rape - Watch What you Drink" campaign over the festive season, which calls on the public to take extra care, particularly in relation to alcohol which is involved in over 50% of date rape drugging cases.
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Scott Barrie*

S1M-3773 Pauline McNeill: Drug Rape-That the Parliament congratulates Strathclyde Police on responding to increasing public concern over date rape drugs and taking the matter seriously and welcomes the force's "Drug Rape - Watch What you Drink" campaign over the festive season, which calls on the public to take extra care, particularly in relation to alcohol which is involved in over 50% of date rape drugging cases. Supported by: Scott Barrie
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Mr Tom McCabe*, Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Mr Michael McMahon*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Trish Godman*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Kay Ullrich*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Michael Matheson*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Nora Radcliffe*, Johann Lamont*, Dr Richard Simpson*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Elaine Smith*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3773 Drug Rape (lodged on 15 January 2003) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-3773 Pauline McNeill: Drug Rape—That the Parliament congratulates Strathclyde Police on responding to increasing public concern over date rape drugs and taking the matter seriously and welcomes the force's "Drug Rape - Watch What you Drink" campaign over the festive season, which calls on the public to take extra care, particularly in relation to alcohol which is involved in over 50% of date rape drugging cases. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Mr Tom McCabe, Brian Fitzpatrick, Mr Michael McMahon, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Trish Godman, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Kay Ullrich, Ms Sandra White, Michael Matheson, Nora Radcliffe, Johann Lamont, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr Gil Paterson, Elaine Smith, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Kenneth Gibson
